fields.description: Sore, swollen feet: Will they ever go down?
fields.title: BeginnerMom
fields.content:
Brought to you by MAMA

I thought I would get morning sickness, weird food cravings and swollen breasts during pregnancy. I thought I would feel loving and emotional. Or different in some way. But I feel totally normal! 

Honestly I can understand those girls who say that they didn’t even know they were pregnant! If I hadn’t missed a period and gone to the clinic for a test I would never have known. No morning sickness. No cravings. I feel nothing. My life just goes on as always.

I can’t stand garlic though… we actually have to throw out the garlic in the house because the smell is too much for me. I eat more. My mother complains because she isn’t used to me eating so much (but I think she’d probably complain if I didn’t eat enough!)

So she fusses over me and I enjoy it. In fact I feel even better than I usually do! 

My allergies seem to have disappeared – probably because of the good food I am eating. I am still active. My friends and family are shocked that I am still doing errands up to such a late date. But life continues doesn’t it? I haven’t gained too much weight and I only started showing late into my 5th month. 

My worst symptom is the swollen feet! The baby is sitting more on my left side so my left foot has swollen up to almost double its size. It looks scary and ugly. Closed shoes are not an option and I only have one pair of sandals that I can wear. Or my house slippers! 

I worry my feet will permanently grow and then what kind of ladies’ shoes will I find in such a big size?

**MAMA HELP: Swollen feet (edema) during pregnancy can get worse as your due date nears. It may not be comfortable, but it’s harmless and normal. It should ease up overnight. If it doesn’t, or if your hands or face become puffy, visit your clinic for a check-up.**
